title: Who might Bob Dylan been referring to in the song, ‘She Belongs to Me’? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think part of Bob Dylan’s genius was his ability to understand a situation, and find the words to explain it to the rest of us as though he were speaking directly into our heads. He understood us. With, She Belongs To Me, I believe Bob is pulling together all the feelings men have about women, and in there are his own reactions to loving … This woman we adore is a child in ways. She can do no wrong - the child who can play forever with the simplest toys, who plays with crayons and creates a picture, just as it suits her, and we are entranced by it, by her. ‘Look what you’ve done.’ She is the girl you idolize, the girl you bow to, the girl whose birthday you make into the biggest occasion you really cannot afford. The girl to whom you give freedom if need be, yet find yourself looking in her keyhole because you simply must know. Of course you buy her toys.

I think this woman he is referring to ist fictional. Because from the lyrics you get the impression that ths woman is powerful and to be feared. In his normal life he always choose weak women. Maybe he made this song for a certain woman in whose pants he tried to get, and this song is just sweettalking
